summary: Build an app that makes home screen app icons fall over and roll around based on device tilt across phone, tablet, and computer.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Playful abstract phone wallpaper background, warm gradient with subtle noise texture (wallpaper.dim_1170x2532.png)
- Rounded-square app icon: camera symbol, flat vector, high contrast (icon-camera.dim_256x256.png)
- Rounded-square app icon: music note symbol, flat vector, high contrast (icon-music.dim_256x256.png)
- Rounded-square app icon: chat bubble symbol, flat vector, high contrast (icon-chat.dim_256x256.png)
- Rounded-square app icon: map pin symbol, flat vector, high contrast (icon-map.dim_256x256.png)
- Rounded-square app icon: game controller symbol, flat vector, high contrast (icon-game.dim_256x256.png)
- Rounded-square app icon: settings gear symbol, flat vector, high contrast (icon-settings.dim_256x256.png)

existing_features.title: Implement a single-page interactive simulation of a device “home screen” where a set of app icons can fall over and roll around inside the app when the user tilts their phone/iPad or moves an equivalent control on desktop.
Use device tilt on supported mobile/tablet browsers via DeviceOrientation (or equivalent) and provide a clear permission request flow for iOS/iPadOS when required.

Provide desktop (computer) controls to drive the same tilt input without relying on device sensors (e.g., mouse drag to set gravity direction and/or keyboard controls), including a “Reset” action to re-center and re-stack icons.

Implement lightweight 2D physics behavior for icons (gravity from tilt vector, collision against bounds, and icon-to-icon collisions with basic restitution/friction) sufficient to create a ‘fall over and roll around’ effect.
Add a coherent, distinct visual theme for the app UI and apply it consistently (colors, typography, spacing, and components), avoiding a blue/purple-dominant palette.
Add generated static image assets for a wallpaper background and a small set of app icons, and render them from the frontend as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated.
